pr_title: Use common model from maven repo

timeline.message: Fix to add architecture in listAvailablePackageMetadata
Use common model in brazil package
Use common model in brazil package

timeline.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: Let's make our ComponentType also strongly typed?
timeline.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: also .name() to prevent unexpected behavior when toString() is overriden
timeline.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: Also let's make it strongly typed
replies.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: I'd like to separate the strongly typed UNARCHIVE and ComponentType in a different PR. Seems that String->Enum type change can bring a lot of scattered diff
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: It already is typed. It was typed in kernel as well as the common model
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: the purpose of raw is that it does not exist (in cloud). That's how I'm able to tell that it is working.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Since componentType in common model is enum. When parsing from recipe, the "raw" will be ignored.
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.bodyText: null might be fine. Customers shouldn't be specifying it
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Is it only specified by lambda launcher?
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: Component type is used by us for plugin and lambda, that's all
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: what happened to the strong typing?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Or I guess, why are there 2 "Unarchive"s? Let's just use one
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText:
Yeah. We have kernel/model/PackageRecipe vs common/model/ComponentRecipe because they now differ completely. But I'm fine with they both use same type from common model, like for "componentType" to use common/model/ComponentType.
The alternative is to have two set of models completely. For example,  kernel/model/ComponentType vs common/model/ComponentType. But it's a lot of additional work and we don't really gain any benefit until these two models differ. (ex. need to add device specific helper logic).
replies.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: Having said that though, no additional change is required for this PR - I'm picking this up on top of it to finalize models for B1.
replies.author: leaf94

fix powershell command for windows test
